page.title: 01"Ingworth" Long Meadow.
page.content: Parish of Ingworth has a village of 40 dwellings built with Georgian brick and flintstone having pantile roofs. Longitudinal (north south) o.75 Km long situated along east bank river "Bure". The surrounding level landscape has crop rotation farming of wheat, barley, peas, sugar beet. Whole area comes under conservation and National Trust laws. 70 adults work away or are retired. 20 children bus to school in Aylsham. St Lawrence church built 1400 AD. has thatched roof,stone/flint walls. "Mill House" Ingworth farms largest flock of Black Welsh mountain sheep in Gt Britain which graze on Blicking meadows west bank of river "Bure". River "Bure" has Trout Roach and Pike fishing. Swans Ducks Egyptian Geese nest on its banks.
